ContainerBlockElement.Paragraph: A logic issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in macOS Monterey 12.0.1. A malicious application may be able to elevate privileges.

ListItem.Paragraph: Apply the necessary updates by selecting 'Software Update' from the Apple menu, or by using the softwareupdate utility
Apply the necessary updates by selecting 'Software Update' from the Apple menu, or by using the softwareupdate utility

ContainerBlockElement.Paragraph: An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in macOS Monterey 12.0.1, Security Update 2021-007 Catalina, macOS Big Sur 11.6.1. Processing a maliciously crafted AppleScript binary may result in unexpected application termination or disclosure of process memory.

This issue is fixed in iOS 15.1 and iPadOS 15.1, macOS Monterey 12.0.1, iOS 14.8.1 and iPadOS 14.8.1, tvOS 15.1, watchOS 8.1, Security Update 2021-007 Catalina, macOS Big Sur 11.6.1. A malicious application may be able to elevate privileges.

Apply the necessary updates by selecting 'Software Update' from the Apple menu, or by using the softwareupdate utility

The issue was resolved with additional restrictions on CSS compositing. This issue is fixed in tvOS 15, watchOS 8, iOS 15 and iPadOS 15. Visiting a maliciously crafted website may reveal a user's browsing history.
Apple Mac OS X <= 12.0.1
Apply the necessary updates by selecting 'Software Update' from the Apple menu, or by using the softwareupdate utility

A logic issue was addressed with improved restrictions. This issue is fixed in macOS Monterey 12.0.1, iOS 15.1 and iPadOS 15.1, watchOS 8.1, tvOS 15.1. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to unexpectedly unenforced Content Security Policy.
Apple Mac OS X <= 12.0.1
Apply the necessary updates by selecting 'Software Update' from the Apple menu, or by using the softwareupdate utility

An information leakage issue was addressed. This issue is fixed in iOS 15.1 and iPadOS 15.1, macOS Monterey 12.0.1, iOS 14.8.1 and iPadOS 14.8.1, tvOS 15.1, watchOS 8.1. A malicious website using Content Security Policy reports may be able to leak information via redirect behavior .
Apple Mac OS X <= 12.0.1
Apply the necessary updates by selecting 'Software Update' from the Apple menu, or by using the softwareupdate utility

A buffer overflow issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in macOS Monterey 12.0.1, iOS 15.1 and iPadOS 15.1, watchOS 8.1, tvOS 15.1. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.
Apple Mac OS X <= 12.0.1
Apply the necessary updates by selecting 'Software Update' from the Apple menu, or by using the softwareupdate utility

A logic issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in macOS Monterey 12.0.1, iOS 15.1 and iPadOS 15.1, watchOS 8.1, tvOS 15.1. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to universal cross site scripting.
Apple Mac OS X <= 12.0.1
Apply the necessary updates by selecting 'Software Update' from the Apple menu, or by using the softwareupdate utility

An issue existed in the specification for the resource timing API. The specification was updated and the updated specification was implemented. This issue is fixed in macOS Monterey 12.0.1. A malicious website may exfiltrate data cross-origin.
Apple Mac OS X <= 12.0.1
Apply the necessary updates by selecting 'Software Update' from the Apple menu, or by using the softwareupdate utility

Description: A logic issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in iOS 15 and iPadOS 15, macOS Monterey 12.0.1. Turning off "Block all remote content" may not apply to all remote content types.
Apple Mac OS X <= 12.0.1
Apply the necessary updates by selecting 'Software Update' from the Apple menu, or by using the softwareupdate utility

A type confusion issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in Safari 15.1, tvOS 15.1, iOS 15 and iPadOS 15, macOS Monterey 12.0.1, watchOS 8.1. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to code execution.
Apple Mac OS X <= 12.0.1
Apply the necessary updates by selecting 'Software Update' from the Apple menu, or by using the softwareupdate utility
A logic issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in macOS Monterey 12.0.1. An attacker may be able to track users through their IP address.
Apple Mac OS X <= 12.0.1
Apply the necessary updates by selecting 'Software Update' from the Apple menu, or by using the softwareupdate utility

vulnerability.title: OS X update for Windows Server (CVE-2021-30908)

ContainerBlockElement.Paragraph: An authentication issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in macOS Monterey 12.0.1, macOS Big Sur 11.6.1. A local attacker may be able to view the previous logged-in user’s desktop from the fast user switching screen.

ListItem.Paragraph: Apply the necessary updates by selecting 'Software Update' from the Apple menu, or by using the softwareupdate utility
Apply the necessary updates by selecting 'Software Update' from the Apple menu, or by using the softwareupdate utility

ContainerBlockElement.Paragraph: This issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Monterey 12.0.1. Unpacking a maliciously crafted archive may allow an attacker to write arbitrary files.

ListItem.Paragraph: Apply the necessary updates by selecting 'Software Update' from the Apple menu, or by using the softwareupdate utility
Apply the necessary updates by selecting 'Software Update' from the Apple menu, or by using the softwareupdate utility
Apply the necessary updates by selecting 'Software Update' from the Apple menu, or by using the softwareupdate utility

ContainerBlockElement.Paragraph: An inherited permissions issue was addressed with additional restrictions. This issue is fixed in macOS Monterey 12.0.1, Security Update 2021-007 Catalina, macOS Big Sur 11.6.1. A malicious application may be able to modify protected parts of the file system.

ListItem.Paragraph: Apply the necessary updates by selecting 'Software Update' from the Apple menu, or by using the softwareupdate utility
Apply the necessary updates by selecting 'Software Update' from the Apple menu, or by using the softwareupdate utility
Apply the necessary updates by selecting 'Software Update' from the Apple menu, or by using the softwareupdate utility

ContainerBlockElement.Paragraph: Web servers that respond to the OPTIONS HTTP method expose what other methods are supported by the web server, allowing attackers to narrow and intensify their efforts.

Paragraph.Paragraph: Disable HTTP OPTIONS method on your web server. Refer to your web server's instruction manual on how to do this.
Web servers that respond to the OPTIONS HTTP method expose what other methods are supported by the web server, allowing attackers to narrow and intensify their efforts.
Disable the OPTIONS method by including the following in the Apache configuration:
Disable the OPTIONS method by doing the following in the IIS manager

OrderedList.ListItem: Select Request filtering and change to HTTP verb tab
Select Deny Verb from the actions pane
Type OPTIONS into the provided text box and press OK

Paragraph.Paragraph: Disable the OPTIONS method by adding the following line to your server block, you can add other HTTP methods to be allowed to run after POST
limit_except GET POST { deny all; }

ContainerBlockElement.Paragraph: A NetBIOS NBSTAT query will obtain the status from a NetBIOS-speaking endpoint, which will include any names that the endpoint is known to respond to as well as the device's MAC address for that endpoint. A NBSTAT response is roughly 3x the size of the request, and because NetBIOS utilizes UDP, this can be used to conduct traffic amplification attacks against other assets, typically in the form of distributed reflected denial of service (DRDoS) attacks.
NetBIOS can be important to the proper functioning of a Windows network depending on the design. Restrict access to the NetBIOS service to only trusted assets.

vulnerability.title: SSH Weak Message Authentication Code Algorithms

ContainerBlockElement.Paragraph: The SSH server supports cryptographically weak Hash-based message authentication codes (HMACs) including MD5 or 96-bit Hash-based algorithms.
Consult the product documentation for instructions to disable any insecure MD5 or 96-bit HMAC algorithms within the SSH configuration.

A UPnP SSDP M-SEARCH request can be used to search a network for UPNP devices. An M-SEARCH response is roughly 30x the size of the request and can be distributed across multiple responses from multiple hosts, and because it utilizes UDP, this can be used to conduct traffic amplification attacks against other assets, typically in the form of distributed reflected denial of service (DRDoS) attacks.
Restrict access to the UPnP service to only trusted assets.
